documents.document: my mum: u hang up first me: no u hang up first my mum: fine
from my window overlooking the city, i can see apocalyptic sheets of horizontal rain flowing over wellington
today i saw a flat so unfurnished that it didn't even come with a stove top #why
@leemurraywriter hahha that would be perfect!!
@alexa_ruthless S A M E. the flat hunt is killing me rn
legit everyone in my everton summer flat is chinese, which makes me think they just saw my last name and were like, yup let's put her here
masterchef australia, but every time george calombaris says yum, it gets faster @bowenshi_nz
-closes laptop- well, i sufficiently feel like i'm dying i think i've looked at enough flats today
my mum: wow it's raining, why did no one bring an umbrella / me: well i live in wellington so i haven't seen an umbrella in 3 years
whenever i see a wishbone outside of wellington: hello my lost brethren
not sure whether putting a blonde streak through my black hair has made it look better or just outed my true form, a 2000s emo kid
@DonalSkehan thank you so much (and for the fab recipe as well)! ðŸ˜Š
@lightyouonfire @bowenshi_nz wish i could do delivery! i'm in auckland right now ðŸ™ƒ
me and @bowenshi_nz made @DonalSkehan's black forest pavlova. YUM ðŸ˜‹ https://t.co/tAobiCtg9a
me @ every view since i came back from greece: where's the parthenon tho
dad woke me up this morning for the market + in my dazed state i thought, what the HELL i dont need to be woken up, ive FINISHED high school
-rolls up sleeves- if there's one thing my mother taught me, it was to buy things from the back of the shelf
me in greece: i have bought too many clothes i must stop me in italy: -buys clothes- oh no
jewellery store owner: this is yours -gives ring- and now this is mine -takes my credit card- ha just joking / me: ha ha ha -eye twitches-
if the olive museum is CLOSED on our only FREE DAY in sparta then what's even the POINT
fave card of the night @ClaudiaJardine https://t.co/QRT5QZ3aza
an update on preparation for my next site presentation: i am watching other peoples' travel videos of ancient corinth
2poor2furious
-opens bag- -greek breadsticks fall out-
day 14 in greece: it finally rains for the first time since i got here. well, i felt only like max 5 raindrops on my face but still, rain
i bought something different at the bakery for lunch today but it turned out to be just another variation of a cheese pie #thwartedagain
there's even annoying car window washers at intersections in crete!? wow, some things truly do cross cultural boundaries
@alexa_ruthless -nods wisely- of course, of course
-swirls cretan tap water in cup- yes. a smooth texture, though not quite the fresh undertone of new zealand water. still a solid 3/5.
forever lowkey sad that my mum made me play piano as a kid instead of guitar. maybe i will never become a rockstar
i briefly forgot what country i was in while shopping a H&M and spoke fluent english at a poor greek guy. i am so sorry
banana got squashed in my bag. bag now full of banana guts. traumatised.
i was doing well with my conversation in greek with the cashier until we progressed past hello
when i walk down the road + greek men try get me to eat at their restaurants, i feel like im playing assassin's creed + trying to avoid NPCs
wondering which shop i should next drop a â‚¬100 note at #tourist
@cdveloso woke up before i could eat it D;
i also had a dream that i 3D printed a 2m high french fry. it was a wild night
had a dream last night that someone betrayed me (don't know why or how) and woke up really angry till i realised it was a dream
walked round the acropolis today and only cried a little bit. still can't quite believe it
Fun Fact - some flippin turkish commander stored explosive gunpowder in the propylaia (spoiler: it blew up) and thats why it's so ruined
@leemurraywriter aww you are the sweetest, thank you :)
in the british school at athens, feeling very inadequate
got emotional seeing the acropolis in the distance today, might just do my site presentation on the propylaia whilst crying profusely
I JUST GOT OFF THE BUS AND WALKED INTO AN ANKLE DEEP PUDDLE, THEN JUMPED OUT OF THAT PUDDLE BUT LANDED INTO ANOTHER PUDDLE AAAAARGH
moving van guy: oh where are you going? / me: GREECE / moving van guy: OH MAN FCKIN SICK!!!
@alexa_ruthless HAHAH yeah, hey look when did auckland get a parthenon??
@alexa_ruthless yeah!! then land in greece and be like ??? how did i get here ???
@ClaudiaJardine @alexa_ruthless i look forward to it
me flying home to auckland: -creates extensive itemised list- me flying to greece: -throws things in suitcase-
@alexa_ruthless i give that rock an 11/10
me in greece: -points at ruin- that is a very good rock
i'm not a cat or a dog person, i'm actually a hayfever person
i had a dream that all the knives at work turned into meat cleavers. i was cutting lettuce with a cleaver
@BloodGoblet all i'm good for hahha
i was falling asleep at a pub quiz cause i know nothing, then a classics question came up and everyone started shouting at me
me: wow i am so keen to roast some vegetables oven: -breaks- me: wow
someone: -talking about something- me: yeah that's cool oh hey did you know it's six days till i go to greece?
i accidentally cut myself at work but didn't notice it at first, so i just brushed it off as beetroot juice. it was NOT beetroot juice
@ClaudiaJardine something like this for greece but more interesting and longer and more greece?
my october 2016 [in seconds] https://t.co/QlEzUsJY4j
i have a bag of expired bread crumbs. should i throw them across the street and become the Pigeon Queen
warning: if you talk to me in the next week, i will probably grab your shoulders, hiss GREEECE, then whisper the number of days till 13 nov
when will my concentration come back from the war
@MakaroPress where has Polina Kouzminova been my whole life!? i'm loving 'an echo where you lie' so so much <3
i just took out my collection of plastic bags from my wardrobe and now i feel like i'm in a sea of suffering
the last 10 minutes of me packing has just been staring at empty boxes and feeling overwhelmed
time to apply for study link, ie. realise that i've forgotten my realme password and spend time answering questions about my childhood
my flatmate moved the microwave onto the shelf so now it feels like i'm making a sacrifice to the gods
Classical Studies, aka Cool History
i went opshopping and got a $10 Cashmere Sweater so i can go to the golf clubs and drink champagne every evening
glad to see countdown metro getting their priorities straight and stocking coriander
strange. i seem to have finished my degree, somehow
creative writing folio all printed, just one exam left to smash out tomorrow ðŸ™ƒ https://t.co/OC7lkfDiZA
Collagen: A Love Story #CREW352
my hair only looks really good rn because i haven't been outside in two days
when i leave my the 1975 playlist off shuffle and it descends from party tunes to ambient sound + im sitting there in the dark like who am i
you vs the guy she told you not to worry about https://t.co/DerCHJPBEo
ME: time 2 study email: 40% OFF ALL STOCK ME: time 2 shop
@alexa_ruthless at first when i saw your tweet i was like, YESS, then my realistic self kicked in and was like, uh, get back to study
@alexa_ruthless oh i wish i could!! these final hand ins are killing me rn ðŸ˜µ
wtf wellington, get a grip on yourself #just6amworkthings https://t.co/EyfPaNMO8W
how to cook with emma: - dice onion - cry - keep crying
MY 220 is a very cold exam room
the battery is running low on both my laptop and my phone and so am i
my friend: do you have internet in greece? / me: yah so i can keep you updated on my travels / my friend: o i just wanted to send you memes
@alexa_ruthless omg :o we've come so far
#tbt to my first year exam study plan. look at all that blessed TIME. i'm jealous https://t.co/DqqxfXXSbN
dried banana chips almost taste like potato chips if i close my eyes and forget that i'm suffering
if i put my cress and coriander plant in the same pot, will they fight to the death? (that's how gardening works, right)
what a beautiful day to go to uni
@dannybultitude awww, no worries! poetry can be whatever you want it to be :D
@dannybultitude this is fantastic. also u could try out prose poetry - closer to the structure of prose without the expectations
nothing like watching hercules for the millionth time to get the feels going
sometimes i trust the intuition of customers and sometimes they ask for ketchup on their whitebait and i wanna cry
me with smudged eyeliner + a $1 frozen coke using the james cook hotel lift, walking thru the foyer as a guy in tux plays piano: yo waddup
almost missed the train to work. i think that's enough running for the rest of my life.
@ClaudiaJardine that is amazing. my life has been enlightened
@ClaudiaJardine i am way too proud of this tweet
